hints.content:
$615 = \goldE{?}+ 544$

![A number line with 2 points labeled. An arrow from point 544 to point 615 is labeled, plus question mark.](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/524aa8728ca4790e55cad9cd1c938251714bcb68)

Let's start by adding hundreds to ${544}$ until we get as close to  ${615}$ as possible without going over ${615}$.

We cannot add any hundreds without going over ${615}$.

Next, let's add tens to $544$ until we get as close to  ${615}$ as possible without going over ${615}$.

$\begin{align}
544 +\blueD{10}=554\\\\
{554} +\blueD{10}= 564\\\\
{564} +\blueD{10}= 574\\\\
{574} +\blueD{10}= 584\\\\
{584} +\blueD{10}= 594\\\\
{594} +\blueD{10}= 604\\\\
{604} +\blueD{10}= 614
\end{align}$

If we add $\blueD{7 \text{ tens}}$, or $\blueD{70}$, we reach $614$. We cannot add any more tens without going over ${615}$.

![The same number line, with an arrow from point 544 to a new point 614 labeled, "plus 70"](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/96b9afaa6a0713483daaba310bcdd611801e1fd0)

Finally, how many ones should we add to  $614$ to get to  ${615}?$

$614 +\greenD{1}={615}$

![The same number line, with an arrow from point 614 to point 615 labeled, "plus 1"](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/827022498e2c777a182541baa342fdcde66e1b14)

We added $\blueD{7 \text{ tens}}$ and $\greenD{1\text{ one}}$ to ${544}$ to get to ${615}$.

$\blueD{7 0}+\greenD{1}=\goldE{71}$

![The number line with all of the arrows shown. The original arrow from point 544 to point 615 is labeled, "plus 71." The arrows spans the arrows labeled, "plus 70," and "plus 1."](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/bf8b373105e2850fa43046a6ea39694e558eb89b)

question.content:
**What number makes this equation true?** 

$615 = {}$ [[â˜ƒ numeric-input 1]] ${} + 544$
